abstract: When the annual sales-and-marketing plan is presented at this company, the associates are asked to vote on their confidence level. Last June, the results weren’t so good.
snippet: When the annual sales-and-marketing plan is presented at this company, the associates are asked to vote on their confidence level. Last June, the results weren’t so good.
lead_paragraph: On the morning of June 22, 2009, all 78 associates of SRC Power Systems, which makes custom-engineered power units and is based in Springfield, Mo., filed onto the shop floor to hear an hour-long presentation about the company’s latest sales-and-marketing plan. People grabbed folding chairs where available while others sat on wire containers or floor baskets near their tools and workstations. There was a dark mood in the air. One guy leaned up against an engine crate, his arms folded across his chest and his jaw set. It was as if he already didn’t like what he was about to hear.

headline.main: How We Try to Get Buy-In, Part 1
